smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function render is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreateDialog is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function storageDirs is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function migrate43 is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class BookAdder is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class MediaPlayer is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class Migration24to25 is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function deleteOldBooks is nested too deeply.
Function updateBook is nested too deeply.
Function getChaptersByRootFile is nested too deeply.
Function pause is nested too deeply.
Function naturalCompare is nested too deeply.
Function migrate is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface AppComponent is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class BookPlayChapter contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called correctedName
The data class CachedImage contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called matches
The data class Book contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called updateMetaData
The data class Book contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called updateContent
The data class Book contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called update
The data class Book contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called coverFile
The data class BookContent contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called updateSettings

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function getBookFromDb has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function handleBack has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function canAddNewFolder has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function onAppear has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function mediaItems has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function parse has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function previousByMarks has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function naturalCompare has 11 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function compareTo has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (target - touchOffset) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: target - touchOffset
Parentheses in (target + touchOffset) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: target + touchOffset
Parentheses in (MAX_IMAGE_SIZE - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: MAX_IMAGE_SIZE - 1

Parentheses in (oldItem.id == newItem.id &&
          oldItem.content.position == newItem.content.position &&
          oldItem.name == newItem.name) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: oldItem.id == newItem.id &&
          oldItem.content.position == newItem.content.position &&
          oldItem.name == newItem.name
Parentheses in (byLastPlayed) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: byLastPlayed
Parentheses in ((buttonRepresentingTheFam.left + buttonRepresentingTheFam.right) / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (buttonRepresentingTheFam.left + buttonRepresentingTheFam.right) / 2
Parentheses in ((buttonRepresentingTheFam.top + buttonRepresentingTheFam.bottom) / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (buttonRepresentingTheFam.top + buttonRepresentingTheFam.bottom) / 2
Parentheses in (height / 2f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: height / 2f
Parentheses in ((textPaint.descent() + textPaint.ascent()) / 2f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (textPaint.descent() + textPaint.ascent()) / 2f
Parentheses in (mi.availMem / 3L) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: mi.availMem / 3L
Parentheses in (height / width) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: height / width
Parentheses in (width / height) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: width / height
Parentheses in (halfHeight / inSampleSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: halfHeight / inSampleSize
Parentheses in (halfWidth / inSampleSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: halfWidth / inSampleSize
Parentheses in (book.content.currentChapterIndex + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: book.content.currentChapterIndex + 1
Parentheses in (seekTimeInSeconds * 1000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: seekTimeInSeconds * 1000
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["bookId"])) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["bookId"])
Parentheses in (File(root).name) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: File(root).name
Parentheses in (File(root).name) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: File(root).name

smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of Versions.

smells.name: UnusedImports
smells.description: Unused Imports are dead code and should be removed.

instances.message: The import 'com.android.builder.model.AndroidProject' is unused.
The import 'com.github.benmanes.gradle.versions.updates.DependencyUpdates' is unused.
